description: Campaigning in South Korea’s parliamentary election has underlined the nation’s status as one of the world’s largest crypto markets, with both major political parties touting related inducements to win votes.
title: South Korean Party Pledges Access to US Bitcoin ETFs in Race for Votes

description: Peru’s embattled President Dina Boluarte has had shifting versions about the origins of a set of luxury watches and other jewelry, which further dimmed the reputation of one of the world’s most unpopular leaders.
title: Peru Leader Says Rolexes Were a ‘Loan,’ Bracelet Wasn’t Cartier

description: President Joe Biden plans to tout his administration’s alternative broad-based student-debt relief plan on Monday, according to a White House official, while he’s in Madison, Wisconsin — a city that’s home to thousands of college students in a 2024 battleground state.
title: Biden to Promote Student Loan ‘Plan B’ in Wisconsin College Town

description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission won a jury verdict in its ground-breaking insider-trading case that seeks to bar employees from using non-public information about their own company to place bets on rival stocks.
title: SEC Wins Trial in Novel ‘Shadow’ Insider Trading Crackdown

description: Brazil’s top economic officials are at odds over a closely-watched fiscal target just days before the government must finalize its 2025 budget outline, according to two people with knowledge of the situation.
title: Lula’s Cabinet Spars Over How Lofty Its Budget Surplus Goal Should Be

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Overseas Conflicts Encroaching on the 2024 Presidential Campaign

description: President Joe Biden pressed Congress to quickly approve funds to rebuild a collapsed Baltimore bridge, visiting the site of a disaster that killed six people and shut a major shipping and transportation artery.
title: Biden Urges Congress to Approve Funds for Baltimore Bridge Rebuild

description: Ontario, Canada’s most popular province for international students, will see a smaller decline in the number of new study permits than previous estimates.
title: Ontario to See Smaller Cut From Canada’s Foreign Student Cap

description: Donald Trump’s campaign promise to hike import tariffs could trigger retaliation from other nations including trade partners, Canada’s ambassador to the US warned.
title: Canada Warns Trump 10% Tariff Risks Sparking Global Retaliation

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said his government will have news to announce on mortgages in Canada in the upcoming April 16 budget, but did not provide further details.
title: Trudeau Says News on Mortgages Is Coming in Federal Budget

description: Mark Rutte’s bid to lead NATO faces a fresh hurdle with some Eastern European nations pressing the Dutch prime minister for increased representation for the region among the military alliance’s top level positions.
title: Rutte’s NATO Leadership Bid Confronts Eastern European Demands

description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said he’s “deeply troubled” by reports that Israel used artificial intelligence in its military campaign in Gaza, saying the practice puts civilians at risk and blurs accountability.
title: UN Chief ‘Troubled’ by Reports Israel Used AI to Find Targets

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced measures aimed at making it easier and cheaper to build new homes in Canada, with an emphasis on pre-fabricated modular housing.
title: Trudeau Pushes 3D-Printed, Prefabricated Homes to Solve Supply Crunch

description: Europe needs a digital euro “to keep up with society, to pursue strategic autonomy, and to maintain access to public money in a digital world,” Dutch central bank chief Klaas Knot said on Friday.
title: Dutch Central Banker Says Digital Euro Is Needed for Autonomy

description: Iran said it asked the US to “step aside” as the country prepares a response to a suspected Israeli attack on its consulate in Syria while Hezbollah, its main proxy in the Middle East, warned the Jewish state it’s prepared for war.
title: Iran Tells US to Step Aside as It Readies Response to Israel

description: Ukraine’s largest private energy company DTEK BV seeks to restore almost half of its damaged facilities as early as June after they were targeted in recent Russian attacks.
title: Ukraine Energy Firm Plans to Rebuild Half of Damaged Facilities

description: Some key Israelis are urging their government to abandon plans to invade the southern Gaza city of Rafah after pressure from the US, saying a cease-fire and hostage release should be the priority.
title: Netanyahu’s Plan to Enter Rafah Faces Growing Opposition in Israel

description: The US and China resumed a defense dialog aimed at preventing an inadvertent clash, part of a broader push to resume contacts up and down the chain of command that were severed as tensions spiked over Taiwan and territorial disputes in the South China Sea in recent years.
title: US, China Resume Military Meetings as Diplomatic Thaw Continues

description: Viktor Orban chided Western powers for “meddling” in the affairs of Bosnia-Herzegovina as the Hungarian prime minister received an award from a Russia-friendly Serb leader who has called for seceding from the Balkan nation.
title: Hungary’s Orban Courts Bosnia Serb Leader, Warns of ‘Meddling’

description: The French government will amend regulations and provide subsidies to support the installation of domestically-made solar panels, key for its energy transition, to reduce the dominance of Chinese equipment manufacturers.
title: France to Aid Europe’s Solar Panel Makers to Reduce China’s Dominance

description: Some of Georgia’s powerful and wealthy Republicans, including Home Depot Inc. co-founder Bernie Marcus, former Georgia Senator Kelly Loeffler and her husband, New York Stock Exchange Chairman Jeffrey Sprecher, next week will host a fundraiser for Donald Trump’s presidential bid.
title: Billionaires Bernie Marcus, Jeffrey Sprecher to Host Trump Atlanta Fundraiser

description: A proposed $100 billion fund for Ukraine will help ensure all NATO allies do their part to help Kyiv fend off Russia’s invasion, said NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg amid concerns that some large member countries are lagging behind.
title: NATO Ukraine Fund to Ensure More States Pay, Alliance Chief Says

description: Donald Trump is scheduled to be deposed on April 15 in one of the civil lawsuits stemming from the merger of his social-media startup with a so-called blank check company, the same day the former president is set to appear in court for the start of his first criminal trial.
title: Trump SPAC Deposition Set For Same Day His Criminal Trial Begins

description: Ukrainian drones attacked a military air base in western Russia in a long-range strike aimed at curbing Moscow’s ability to hit its territory with guided bombs.
title: Ukrainian Drone Swarm Attacks Military Airfield Inside Russia

description: Venezuela will grant safe passage to six aides to opposition leader María Corina Machado who are seeking asylum in Argentina, according to two officials with direct knowledge of the matter.
title: Venezuela to Grant Passage to Top Machado Aides to Argentina

description: Iceland’s Prime Minister Katrin Jakobsdottir will quit a year before the next general election to run for president in a move that could cost her environmentalist force the premiership in the north Atlantic nation.
title: Iceland’s Prime Minister Steps Down to Run for President

description: Russia summoned the South Korean ambassador on Friday to protest Seoul’s sanctions over Moscow’s alleged arms trade with North Korea, deepening a spat between the two countries.
title: Russia Summons South Korean Envoy as Ties Worsen Over Sanctions

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Letter of the Law: Government Rift Over Arms Exports To Israel

description: The Irish government has pulled millions of euros of investment from several Israeli companies.
title: Ireland Pulls Multimillion-Euro Investment in Six Israeli Companies

description: President plans a meeting with Elon Musk soon, he says in interview
title: Argentina’s Javier Milei Talks Up His Peso Plans, China, Trump and Israel

description: Kuwaitis voted to bring back the majority of lawmakers who served in the parliament dissolved by the country’s ruler less than two months ago, with the opposition coalition retaining overall control.
title: Kuwaitis Reelect Most Members of Former Disbanded Parliament

description: Just over 100 days into his administration, Javier Milei is delaying his ambitious reform plans to account for the political and economic realities of Argentina.
title: Milei Sees Long Slog Ahead to Bring Argentina Reforms He Pledged

description: The Israeli army dismissed two officers over a missile strike on a World Central Kitchen convoy this week that killed seven aid workers.
title: Israel Dismisses Two Officers After Deadly Aid Convoy Strike

description: Dutch election winner Geert Wilders dropped his pledge for “a binding referendum on Nexit” ahead of June’s European Parliament elections, as he edges closer to forming the Netherlands’ next government.
title: Wilders Drops Pledge to Leave EU Ahead of European Elections

description: Norway plans to almost double its defense spending over the next 12 years as the energy-rich nation seeks to adapt to threats from neighboring Russia.
title: Norway to Nearly Double Defense Spending by 2036 in New Plan

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The Wild Man of Argentina Bends to China Reality

description: Subsidized insurance would attract investors to help rebuild Ukraine’s war-battered economy, according to the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development.
title: EBRD Calls For Subsidized Insurance to Quickly Rebuild Ukraine

description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said he would seek to build a multilayered defense network with other countries while bolstering military cooperation with the US as he seeks to strengthen Japan’s deterrence in a challenging security environment.
title: Japan’s Kishida Advocates Wider Defense Network Ahead of US Trip

description: John Paulson, the man famous for a big bet against subprime mortgages at his now-closed hedge fund, is luring other billionaires back into Donald Trump’s orbit to support his rematch against Joe Biden.
title: Billionaire John Paulson Explains Why He’s Raising $43 Million for Trump

description: Turkey’s trade with Russia is stuttering because of Western sanctions, hitting a key supply line for Moscow and one the US and European Union say fuels its war in Ukraine.
title: Turkey’s Trade Boom With Russia Stalls Under Weight of Sanctions

description: Latvia wants to improve the enforcement of European Union sanctions against Russia by deploying the tools it’s used to stamp out illicit financing.
title: Latvia Deploys Finance Tools to Fight Russian Sanctions Evasion

description: The governor of Russia’s northwestern Murmansk region was stabbed in the stomach after a meeting with local residents, the most dangerous assault on a high-ranking government official in more than a decade.
title: Russian Regional Governor Stabbed in Rare Attack on Official

description: Over a third of the most-threatening criminal networks in the European Union are laundering their profits through real estate, according to a report on organized crime across the region.
title: Organized Crime Is Laundering Money Through European Real Estate

description: India’s largest opposition party released its political manifesto on Friday, two weeks before voters in the world’s most populous nation head to the polls to elect new leadership.
title: India’s Largest Opposition Congress Party Pledges Jobs, Farmer Welfare in Manifesto

description: Taiwan officials said aid is flowing to hundreds of people on the island’s eastern side who are still stranded by road closures and debris following the island’s worst earthquake since 1999.
title: Taiwan Says Aid Reaching Hundreds of People Stranded by Quake

description: Turkey suspended an arms treaty that imposed limits on conventional military equipment in Europe, joining NATO allies who did the same after Russia withdrew from the agreement last year.
title: Turkey Joins NATO Allies in Suspending Europe Arms Treaty

description: In late 2019, the European Union kicked off its Green Deal with the aim of leading the world into a sustainable future. Then came Covid, surging inflation, broken supply chains and Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: Protests and Prices Push Europe Into Remaking Its Green Deal

description: Hello, this is Jasmine Ng in Singapore.
title: Xi Faces Tough Choice Between Biden and Trump

description: Leaders of the Philippines, US and Japan will tackle at next week’s meeting the recent incidents in the South China Sea which escalated tensions between Manila and Beijing, a Philippine official said.
title: US, Philippines, Japan to Tackle South China Sea Incidents

description: Microsoft says fabricated pictures aimed to kindle dissent
title: Bogus AI Images Used By Pro-China Accounts To Inflame US Opinion

description: South Korea plans to launch its second domestically made spy satellite Monday on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket, enabling it to keep closer tabs on threats from the likes of nuclear-armed North Korea.
title: South Korea to Launch Second Home-Grown Spy Satellite on Monday

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen kicked off her latest visit to China with a pledge to work toward better economic ties, and a warning that Chinese overcapacity in manufacturing poses risks for the rest of the world economy.
title: Yellen Starts China Tour With Warning on Factory ‘Overcapacity’

description: South Korea is in talks with China and Japan to host a three-way summit in May, Japanese and South Korean media reported, restoring a process that has been on hold since 2019 due to the pandemic and political tensions.
title: China, Japan, South Korea Looking to Hold Summit in May, Reports Say

description: El presidente Javier Milei está adoptando un tono más suave que cuando era candidato, al afirmar que no tocará los acuerdos comerciales existentes con Pekín.
title: Renunciar a China es difícil, incluso para el anarcocapitalista argentino
